entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: The main character of the story, introduced as 'H ARRY POTTER' in the first line. He is described as realizing that there was somebody else in the room.

entities.name: morfin gaunt
entities.description: A person mentioned in a rhyme, where it says 'You be good to Morfin / Or he’ll nail you to the door.' He is described as having eyes that stare in opposite directions.

entities.name: merope gaunt
entities.description: A girl whose ragged grey dress matches the dirty stone wall behind her. She has a plain, pale face and stares in opposite directions like her brother Morfin. She is described as looking defeated.

entities.name: ogden
entities.description: A person who greets Merope with 'Good morning,' but she does not answer.

relationships.description: Harry realized that there was somebody else in the room, a girl whose ragged grey dress was the exact colour of the dirty stone wall behind her.
Ogden said 'Good morning,' to Merope, but she did not answer.
In the rhyme, it says 'You be good to Morfin / Or he’ll nail you to the door.'
